website_summaries.verdict: Parents love the comfortable fit and different positions of this mid-range baby carrier.
pros: X-crossing straps keeps parents more comfortable
cons: Many parents complain that the belt clip is difficult to open

customer_reviews.title: Definitely cooler than other carriers
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is far cooler than the others I have tried. I run warm and baby is basically a toaster oven. We went on a 3 mile walk in this carrier at about 75 degrees and neither of us broke a sweat.
customer_reviews.author: APW

customer_reviews.title: Love this carrier!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 week old daughter will NOT let me put her down. I have two other brand name carriers. One was just too warm and the other I needed an infant insert. The Beco Gemini is easy to use and so lightweight. I couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saving the best for last
customer_reviews.text: This is the best carrier, especially with the Cool Mesh! I hated several from Infantimo including Flip 4 in 1, Go Forward, etc., Ergo 360, and the Bjorn. I'm 5'9" with a larger frame and this carrier is very comfortable and distributes the baby's weight. I really love the added option of the "hip-carry" - not many carriers offer this. It's also very breathable! We spent long hot summer days using this without any chaffing or feeling too hot or weighed down.
customer_reviews.author: LBurnholz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for baby and parent!
customer_reviews.text: The straps can cross in the back which makes baby wearing a lot more comfortable! The shoulder straps are padded and the buckles are easy. The seat can be narrow which my petite baby needed. We had a Tula free to grow and she would cry because of the wide seat.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha S.

customer_reviews.title: Good carrier
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, super comfy fit with baby. Forward facing it kind of hits his legs weird but otherwise I love this carrier. Had a boba wrap before which I liked but was hard to keep tight enough and not enough support. Found this one and gave it a shot. I'm glad I did. Distributes weight well and takes most of the pressure off of my lower back unlike the other carrier also.
customer_reviews.author: The Kimberly's

customer_reviews.title: Safety Clips are a great idea, but really difficult to undo (by the parent).
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted to try this carrier because she had heard it works well for more petite frames. What attracted her was the X-back of the straps, which supposedly helps with the support. She tried it on once with these comments: 1) does not feel comfortable for both herself and our baby 2) while the safety clips are a nice feature in the idea they're really hard to get off when it's just one momma carrying around her baby. it takes 2 hands really to get them off. That ended up being the deal-breaker for her. We're just going to stick with our ergo omni.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: A Really Sturdy, Well-Made Carrier (especially for people under 5’5”)
customer_reviews.text: This is a great carrier. We have found that it is the most comfortable of all the carriers we own, both for me and for my husband. The cross-straps in the back are way better than other brands. This carrier feels more friendly to us vertically-challenged people - I had a really hard time with the ErgoBaby carrier because of this (straps were way to big for smaller people). The mesh is great too.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: OMG COMFY!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe I got this SO late. This is my 3rd child. I've had a Tula, Lille, Didymos wraps, Moby wraps, ring slings... and this is HANDS DOWN THE BEST CARRIER EVER. it's so comfy and not hot! And my baby can face out 😍
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: False measurements advertised
customer_reviews.text: Length of belt advertised is 6” shorter. Bought this as it said it was also usable for bigger people. I’m 6’4” and while heavy not so much that I shouldn’t be able to not fit in something deemed big enough for “plus sized people” as explained in its description. The 6” of length it’s lacking is a pretty big deal making this essentially worthless for me so now I get to go waste gas money to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Collins

customer_reviews.title: The perfect carrier varies from person to person
customer_reviews.text: The Beco Gemini is a nice, lightweight, carrier. It is, by far, less bulky than my LILLEbaby. That said, it does not fit comfortably with the straps crossed. Even with the straps uncrossed, my shoulders start aching due to the chest clip being in a fixed position that is not suitable for me personally. This carrier is easy to move from wide seat to narrow seat. It is a breeze to put on and adjust. I recommend giving the Gemini a go if your looking for a nice, lightweight carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Maule

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and cute
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful baby carrier. I had the one from the Honest Company with my second child. I didn't realize they discontinued it so i sought out for the same brand. I found this one and realized it had way cooler styles. This is super comfortable for me to wear and my baby can fall asleep in it like no other. I also don't feel like it gives me that weird mom squish popping out of the sides like the other baby carriers do.
customer_reviews.author: Symantha

customer_reviews.title: Best carrier after trying others
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I tried some other carriers and researched a lot of them without finding something appropriate for us. The Beco Gemini worked perfectly for us. It is lightweight, not bulky, and comfortable for parents and baby. We've already used it in short hiking trips and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Karl Sauter

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and super light weight!
customer_reviews.text: We love this carrier- it works well for me (5'2") and my husband (6'), and it makes it possible to babywear in the Philadelphia summer, which is pretty central to our lives. This carrier also packs down and fits into a diaper bag without too much fuss. The only thing that I don't love is that the mesh leaves an impression on my daughter's legs if she isn't wearing leggings/pants, but it's not enough of an annoyance to impact the way we use it. If you're on the fence you should go for it!
customer_reviews.author: KSands

customer_reviews.title: i don't like the extra safety on the clips (has like and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd baby carrier. Someone gave me an Ergo 360 but the infant insert made the whole thing way too hot. I researched a lot of carriers and decided on this one. Pros: much cooler than other carriers that I have tried, no infant insert needed, many different ways to wear/carry baby Cons: i don't like the extra safety on the clips (has like and extra button to push before can unbuckle the regular buckle) as it makes it more difficult to get on/off therefore defeating the purpose and making it almost more dangerous
customer_reviews.author: Erin Setzer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, supportive carrier in a very cool mesh
customer_reviews.text: Best baby carrier! And I have owned or tried: Ergo, Lillebaby, Tula, and Infantino! The cool mesh is amazing, I can tell a big difference between it and the regular fabric Gemini. My baby also likes it and enjoys forward facing and inward facing. The fabric is comfortable for her also, normally with bare legs! I love the ability to cross the straps, it is life-changing in comfort and ability to baby wear for long periods.
customer_reviews.author: Scott&Wife

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth it! Very nice quality and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I love this carrier! Unlike the others I don’t get back pain with this one. It’s very comfortable, even for long amounts of time. Would highly recommend. I have pink geo dusty one and have received many compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: There are better options
customer_reviews.text: My babies legs get purple every time we use them facing forward. I am afraid this could harm her Also is very confusing to put it on with the x shape on the back, and straights feels uncomfortable or unsecured. I bought this product because I liked the idea that it was cool since I live in a tropical country.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandrina Targa

customer_reviews.title: A bit too hot for summer
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this because it was just way too hot. It hugs you with these cotton layers which is supposed to be more comfortable - and it is. However, it is also more thermal. This may work well in the winter and areas of cold. However, I live in California and this is probably not the product you want to use her during spring/summer times.
customer_reviews.author: Peppa Unboxing

customer_reviews.title: Mesh uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this carrier and a Beko cotton carrier. This carrier was lighter and the fit itself was comfortable. However, the mesh fabric was very scratchy. In the amount of time I had it on to try, it left red marks on both my baby's bare legs and my shoulders. In the end I decided to keep the Beko cotton carrier. It is a bit warmer, but not unbearably so, even in the heat of a Middle East summer. And, more importantly, the cotton is vastly more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: N B.

customer_reviews.title: So cute
customer_reviews.text: The pineapple pattern is so cute in person, the color is more a blue/grey tone! The mesh is not the softest, but it's much breathable than regular one, I live in FL and the weather is hot and humid pretty much all year round, can't wait to use it when my baby arrives! Will update if anything change!
customer_reviews.author: VM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Baby-Wearing
customer_reviews.text: I love this carrier! It’s comfortable for me and for my baby, and she seems to enjoy it so far, though she’s only 7 weeks old so I hope she continues to love it. The only complaint I have is that it does seem to rub on her thighs where they come out of the carrier, and she gets lines there, but it doesn’t seem to bother her at all, and this would happen with any carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany V

customer_reviews.title: Nice but no
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice carrier but not for me. The fabric was a good quality and the comfort was nice. I didn’t like that the straps are in my sons face when he is in the carrier and his head looks to the side. It would get better as he gets older and sits higher but doesn’t work right now.
customer_reviews.author: LindseyT

customer_reviews.title: Nice and breathable!
customer_reviews.text: I came from a regular tula that just got too hot so I hardly used it (Minnesota even!) So I got this and it's amazing in any weather. We're not big sweatballs anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great weight distribution, baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: Where was this with my First kid? After a few practice runs learning how it works, getting this thing on it easy. The pattern is darling. My baby is happy in it as she can face forward while I get things done around the house or go for a walk. If she is super tired, we flip her around to face our chest and she sleeps all cuddled up on our chests. Most important, this carrier distributed the weight in such a way that your lower back does not hurt like mine has in other carriers. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: zerogirlhero

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it love it love it! My boy is 14 months old and it's still very easy to carry him on long trips. He liked this carrier since day one and has enjoyed it constantly ever since. Fabric is comfy, easy to clean, gentle over skin. We do get warm some times, but I just try to keep clothes according to the weather and the's about it. Head support is the best feature, even though I use the phone pocket a lot, and recently love crossing the straps on the back. For us, it's a must.
customer_reviews.author: Lupe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is everything! It fits both me and hubby and is easily adjustable. I love that is has the cool mesh. My son wasn't a sweaty mess when he was in it. I've only worn him in the front forward facing and it was easy on my shoulders and back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: I've used this carrier so much, even for hikes. In fact I never even use a stroller because I find a carrier more efficient and also better for a happier baby. Being able to breastfeed on the go with a carrier like this makes life with a new babe so much less stressful and gives back some freedom. The only downside to this carrier is in summer time it's pretty hot which is why I got a second all linen carrier for summer hot days!
customer_reviews.author: Tori C.

customer_reviews.title: New fabric could scrub pots and pans
customer_reviews.text: The original Gemini came with these ridiculous “safety locks” which were a nightmare to get out of. Now , thank god those are gone. Unfortunately, the “cool” fabric is similar to something I would use to scrub pots! It’s scratchy and my baby hates it.
customer_reviews.author: KMiller

customer_reviews.title: Finally one that works!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this carrier!! My baby girl and I are both petite and this is the only one we both are comfortable in but it is also comfortable for my 6ft tall husband to use with her too! It’s not bulky at all like some of my other carriers we’ve tried, super easy to do the crisscross strap style when you’re by yourself or in a rush. Compact enough also to hook babe in while sitting on a small airplane also (if you are a traveler). Highly, highly recommend the Beco Gemini carrier! :)
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: So easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: Love, love this carrier. So easy to put on; I really struggled with the Ergo between the shoulders strap. The mesh is cool and baby feels secure.
customer_reviews.author: Kristel

customer_reviews.title: Cute and functional
customer_reviews.text: First, this carrier is adorable. The pattern is really cute. The structure is well made and it feels really sturdy. I also think it distributes the weight really evenly. I like everything about it except my 2 month old slips down pretty far. I’m sure I’m going to love it even more when she’s a tiny bit bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Carriane Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Cool mesh, has storage pocket.
customer_reviews.text: I used an older version of the Beco Gemini with my first daughter, and always found myself wishing for a pocket on this carrier. With my second daughter, I was pleased to find that the newer version and have a pocket and that the clips and cord for the folding head support were replaced with buckets and straps, which are much less abrasive on baby’s head. I ended up buying a new carrier for these features as well as the cool/breathable mesh aspect of this version of the Gemini.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Linker

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Carrier
customer_reviews.text: My wife purchased this and she loved it already. We lives in Florida where the weather can be hot most of the time, and this product works perfectly. She does not get sweaty when in use. We used the previous carrier (bjorn) and she cannot stand wearing it for an hour. This one, she does not mind wearing all day. Excellent product, you wont regret it especially if you live in a hot weather state like Florida.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this I'm in Arizona and it's perfect for our warm weather! I use this daily! And it fits a wide range of people from very thin to 2x male with extra slack...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect carrier
customer_reviews.text: Excited to try this out when our little one gets here. I researched and decided the Becco was the one for me....and Amazon had the best price
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: good weight distribution poor functionality
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because the buckles were way too difficult to unlock and require two hands which is really hard when you are trying to unload the baby. So while this carrier is really comfortable I just couldn't see it working when your out and alone. You either need to be able to use the bed unload the baby or have another adult help. This carrier is also very bulky and takes some practice to figure out how to use it. I ended up getting the Bjorn one because it is easier to use and is less bulky. The beco does distribute the babies weight on the hips better though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short straps
customer_reviews.text: I could barely fit me (5’7” 155lbs) and newborn baby (7lb) in this carrier, the straps were not long enough. I’m assuming this was a manufacturer’s error bc I have an older Gemini (5yrs old) and it’s plenty big enough !
customer_reviews.author: The Snells

customer_reviews.title: Great and doesn’t take up too much space
customer_reviews.text: I mainly love the look of this and that is is less bulky than what are used to have which is the ergo 360 Omni. I did not have the mesh ergo which would have been better for hot Florida. But instead I got this so that it would be light weight to take for traveling such as on flights
customer_reviews.author: Rishi G.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, supportive, comfortable, and soft!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried multiple carriers and slings, and this one is the most lightweight and soft carrier! It’s easy to put on alone ( others require another person- which is insane), easy to adjust, super comfy for baby, and very supportive for parent! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Karin Machluf

customer_reviews.title: I hate going through the return process especially when I have ...
customer_reviews.text: First off, I ordered black and received grey. I hate going through the return process especially when I have to send things out. So anyway, putting on takes some getting used to and taking off the waist strap can get tedious. I love how cushioned it is from every angle. It's not something that easily fits into a bag so if that's something you are counting on, don't waste your time. I love this carrier and I look forward to carrying my little one facing out now that he can hold his head. I will update once I try every carrying position!
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Rosas

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier
customer_reviews.text: I got this to compare to the Beco 8. I found that the Beco 8 had more features, especially nice that it has an infant insert which the Gemini did not. If my baby was bigger I might have kept this, but I was glad to have easy returns.
customer_reviews.author: Linnae Madison

customer_reviews.title: Felt big for newbie.
customer_reviews.text: I’m short this is less bulky then some others but for 2 month old it felt big my son is almost 4 months and he doesn’t seem like he comfortable in this still. For cost I’m not sure I would get a again. It is cooler material then others.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Adams

customer_reviews.title: Finally! A good carrier that is plus size friendly!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after a disappointing experience with my Moby wrap. It barely fit and felt like it was squeezing my son. After that, I went in search of a sturdier and larger carrier. I'm a size 24 top and size 26 bottom so I needed something roomy and it didn't disappoint! Can't wait to take my little guy out in this!
customer_reviews.author: B. Kreiger

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this carrier!!! It's very lightweight and breathes well in hot/warm weather. There is not an infant insert and it states you don't need one but I found that my little one sat way too low so I use one from another carrier I have. She seems to be more comfortable and less restrained in this one as well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleG

customer_reviews.title: Nice but a little scratchy
customer_reviews.text: It’s really easy to use by my own. But the air mesh part would scratch my boy’s skin. So I always need to keep him with pants on when using this product. I don’t regret buying this thing, but will consider the one without air mesh if I buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: TITZU, WANG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent carrier
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I have three other carriers and borrow this from my cousin one day. By far my favorite. It is the most lightweight but supportive carrier I have. The multi positions are great, as young as 3 months I could face him outward if desired.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Comfortable and fits nice. Baby stays cooler in this one versus others I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to use with my granddaughter. They both love it. My daughter enjoys being hands free and baby Zoey sleeps so soundly. I looked at other carriers and they weren't made as well.
customer_reviews.author: christina stilwell

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy black
customer_reviews.text: I love this carrier. I take my 9 week old in it everywhere. The only flaw that I have noticed is that I got the black one and it is absolutely covered in lint. I will never buy the black one again but I love how easy and comfortable it is to use
customer_reviews.author: amandau1

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not for babies on the smaller side
customer_reviews.text: I liked the tactile feel of this carrier, and the ease of adjusting the belt, but overall, it didn’t work for me. My 6 month old is on the small side (23 inches long and under 12 lbs), and I felt like she was swimming in this. When I faced her out, her face was partially covered by the front flap. Going to try a Tula because it’s recommended for smaller babies.
customer_reviews.author: plants24-7

customer_reviews.title: Prefer over Ergo
customer_reviews.text: I like this carrier much more than my Ergo. I prefer to use the straps crossed and I like how I can get my son in it by myself. The buckles are easy to reach and snap and it is cooler to wear than my Ergo.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Magnusen

customer_reviews.title: Good for this price
customer_reviews.text: I m almost satisfied with it, just think, that's gonna be normal size just till babe will turn 11-12 month, cause it seems like not really big. But all other things are great. Our baby prefer to walk in this carrier in summer days besides staying in the stroller
customer_reviews.author: Maxim Goncharov

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but baby doesn’t like
customer_reviews.text: Straps cross in back which are nice but get tangled on each other. Baby currently hates being worn so will try again when she’s older. Not a miracle carrier. On par with the lillebaby.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Quint

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Living in hot Florida this carrier is a must, were 9 months of the year the weather is above 90 degrees Fahrenheit, easy to use, light material yet sturdy!! I even love the colors!!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Tough buckle release
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this since I needed a carrier for my newborn and I did not want to get an infant insert (too hot where I live). I did read the reviews about the buckles, but Didn't think anything of it. Received the item and was only able to release 2 of the 3 buckles. My husband was able to release it, but after attaching it again, he could not.
customer_reviews.author: Dman78

customer_reviews.title: More complicated than others I've tried
customer_reviews.text: I found this hard to use by myself the first time. The second time, I thought I could figure it out but something didnt work put right. I cant seem to make baby comfortable in this carrier.
customer_reviews.author: amazonbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for petite frame!
customer_reviews.text: I am petite at 5'2" and I love the fact that the straps can cross in the back. To me, the buckles are easy to put together and push apart. I love how it has four positions and is simple. It has no pockets, but I just use a small diaper backpack or cross body if I'm out. If I were to have a complaint, it would be that there is one long strap that hangs down, but I just wrap it over my waist and tuck it in to the other side. I love it and am satisfied. Well worth the money. Definitely works well for me being petite!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Fought

customer_reviews.title: Very soft organic fiber.
customer_reviews.text: Got the organic one, it is supper soft! I have babybjorn as well, gemini is much much softer. It takes couple times to get used to putting it on, but once you’ve mastered it, it is pretty easy. Great for the back. Babybjorn was not giving the needed support.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey G

customer_reviews.title: Like it so far!
customer_reviews.text: This was highly rated on multiple sites and we are using this carrier far more thalike n our Baby Bjorn (which seems to swallow our child!). We've used it so far only as a newborn-forward-facing carrier, but it's easy to put on and I've even been able to breastfeed while he's in the carrier! The hip belt provides great support and the extra "click" on the buckles is a smart safety feature. This carrier is good for using in the home or leaving from home (it's not very portable since it's large and doesn't fold well). Our only complaint is the fabric - it attracts lint like crazy and needs to be brushed off after every use!
customer_reviews.author: P. A.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable fit for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this carrier so much but the straps just didn't fit right. It felt like they narrowed in on my babies head so it seemed uncomfortable for her too. I returned it and got the lillebaby.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Love love love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this baby carrier. I cross cross the straps across my back to get it on me easier. I have had 4 baby carriers and this one is my favorite. I have had the moby (too hard to put on) the baby k'tan and its just not as easy to get him in it and situated, I have slings, baby doesn't like those, but this one is simple, comfortable, and my LO loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this item
customer_reviews.text: Hurt my upper back. Baby seems comfortable though and dozed off. Its really difficult to get the baby in and out of also. Like someone else said, it's also tough to adjust the straps when you're already wearing the baby.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft Structured Carrier! I love the pattern.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the pattern of this baby carrier and the fact that it is a soft structured one. It is also machine washable! I live in Texas and sweat a lot due to the heat, so my other carriers have sweat stains on them. I am able to breastfeed my baby in this as well. I just received it a few weeks ago, so I have not been able to fully test its durability. I wish it had a little extra lower back support, like my Lille Baby though.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bergstrom

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We've a few and this is the easiest to use and also the most comfortable on our shoulders and back. We love the lightweight "cool" fabric and would recommend it over other options available.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Welt

customer_reviews.title: great for petite mom
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'2" 110 lbs and i've been wearing my heavy 10 month old in a different carrier. I finally switched to this one and feel like it's made for my size. very happy
customer_reviews.author: Julie F

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome, uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been very disappointed with this carrier. It’s difficult to secure, difficult to tighten, and baby girl has not enjoyed being in it for more than a couple minutes. It also sags quite a bit in the front, putting a lot of tension on my lower back. I’m not sure if this is an outdated model or a knock off but the straps do not match what’s in the instructional videos.
customer_reviews.author: andrew roberts

customer_reviews.title: Too small for plus size
customer_reviews.text: I'm a plus-size girl 3XL and carry most my weight in my lower stomach. Unfortunately the strap was too short and had to return
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, would recommend to all
customer_reviews.text: The beco is unique when compared to other carriers because not only is it more ergonomically correct for the baby's posture (making the experience much more enjoyable for them) it also is for the parents. My back really hurt in the Bjorn but not at all with this carrier. Also, as opposed to all other carriers out there, you can have the baby face frontwards so to see everything, backwards to face you, on your side or even on your back. The options really are wonderful and make this a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Navin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 different carriers and this one is hands down the best! Lightest! Easiest to put on! And baby likes it. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: lilmamaportland

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and good support
customer_reviews.text: Used it for hiking on our 1 month old baby it works perfect good support and comfort
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to Give it 5 Stars, But...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this thing: it was comfortable, easy to take on and off, great extra support, and special buttons for the clips to protect them from coming undone too easily, but my baby hated being in it. As soon as he was strapped in, front-facing or back, he wanted out! There was nothing wrong with the carrier, though, it was all him. It's a preference thing, I guess, but I loved it (this is why it only got 4 stars from me, though).
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Holly

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, safe and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very useful, safe and comfortable for me and my baby. I`ve been using it since my baby boy was 4 months (now he is 10 months). It`s easy to take on and off (just for the strap around your hips you need both hands to take it off). Many times he falls asleep in this carrier during the walk. He is more than 22 lbs and his weight is perfectly bearable with this carrier. Usually I carry him facing to me and sometimes on my side (great for stuff like cooking or some other activities, when baby likes to watch).
